comment: I loved having professor Huang. She was so nice and understanding. Also made the whole lecture easy and fun. If I could I would love to take her again as my professor.

This was the easiest class I have taken by far! Attendance matters but it contributes to your learning unlike some professors who read off the PowerPoint, Professor Huang is interactive and attentive to her students. Weekly pop quizzes, easy homeworks, and 3 unit tests that you prepare for in class. She provides everything for you to be successful!

Huang 老师 is an incredible professor that cares deeply for her students. I took her 1002 course last spring and felt well prepared for this 2001 course (despite the learning gap in the summer). She is so supporive of student success and will do whatever she can to help you do well in the class. Take this professor!!!!

Class is mandatory, and participation is important. However, if you cannot be in class for illness or other reason, she is understanding. The homework assignments are straightforward and manageable, and she gives plenty of opportunities for extra credit. I definitely recommend taking this professor.
good

She got me into Chinese club, she helped make sure that everything was clear while learning the materials. Honestly, learning Mandarin with her is fun and easy. I can't wait to take more classes with her in the fall. She is the main reason I am an Asian Studies Major now, with Chinese Minor.

Dr. Huang was a great teacher! It was a fairly easy class. There were only 3 tests and the quizzes were exactly what she prepared for us. She's really understanding and if you pay attention, you'll be fine! She loves participation and she broke us out into groups at least 3 times in class. Would take her again.

I took this class on a whim. I got like straight 70s on the daily quizzes bc my work schedule did not always allow for much studying. However, the way the grades are measured it didn't matter. The tests have a TON of bonus point opportunities which makes getting a 100 on them easy even if you are unsure of a few questions. She is nice and helpful.

This class is really easy, but you actually have to attend & put forth effort. She only took attendance a few times, so it is important that you go. She will give you project feedback in front of everyone & you won't get a 100 just for completion, but it's easily attainable. Give yourself ample time to complete and turn in the (online) final.

Prof. Huang is a super sweet and caring lady, the class is lecture-heavy but she tries to make it as interesting as possible for the students. She's very knowledgeable about what she teaches. Class is group project heavy, with some online discussion grades here and there. You get 3 absenses per semester, but she doesn't take attendance everyday.
Huang laoshi is a wonderful and caring professor. She is very engaging and easy to talk to.
Huang Laoshi really cares about her students passing her class and learning. Would recommend her for any level of Chinese.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: There are three group projects and a final. Lecture heavy but she posts all the lectures to d2l. 3 absences allowed but she doesnt take attendance everyday. Group project is anything you choose and pretty easy. Final was online and it was questions from various lectures that you write about, open note. Easy A

Professor Sha Huang is AMAZING!! She is very caring and passionate about what she does. Do not hesitate to ask for help. Be prepared for a quiz every class, they are not difficult. You will retain a lot of info and have an A. TAKE HER.
She's a very good teacher. The study guides are similar to the test or exam.

Professor Huang is amazing! She is very sweet, nice, caring, and super passionate. No tests, just a few discussions boards, a final paper and 2 group projects which are very easy and enjoyable! Along with her teaching teach you about Asian cultures, you actually teach her about American culture! I cant recommend Professor Huang enough. TAKE HER!!!

Attendance is a part of your grade. No tests, grades are mainly group projects and weekly discussions posts. Shes a great teacher and cares about the topics she teaches. I would highly recommend taking her.
Sha Huang is a great teacher and she really takes care to address any of her students questions. I loved her class and she really is a great intro to Chinese

Great professor, Be ready for quizzes at the beginning of class to cover what you learned the last class. The study guides are almost carbon copies of the tests. Study a bit and you should be very successful!
She's so wholesome and the class is really easy
There are no tests in this class, but there are weekly discussions, group projects, and a written final done outside of class. The group projects can be a struggle, but the content is pretty easy.

I really enjoyed this class. I took it to fulfill a gen ed requirement and would take her again if I had the chance. There were weekly discussions but werent difficult. Lectures were interesting and she encourages participation. There werent any tests or quizzes only a few group projects. Prof Huang was very nice and respectful. Take this class!

Professor Huang is an extremely nice, caring, and passionate teacher. She really teaches you about different Asian cultures and the cool thing as that the class teachers her about American culture too. I didn't have a single test in this class. It was 2 group projects, discussion boards, and a final paper which you can use online sources on.

Huang Lao Shi is a very caring professor. She checked up on me via email when I was sick. She didn't go strictly off the textbook and used authentic Chinese reading material in her lectures, which I liked. She doesn't act like she knows everything. She is a relaxed and down to earth person and doesn't make you feel bad if you ask questions.

Good professor. There are quizzes everyday, but they are easy if you study the vocab. The test are similar as long as you put some effort and come to class the test are fairly easy. The first book was necessary, but the second book is not.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Professor Huang is a very engaging and caring professor. I enjoyed the material a lot and especially liked all of the extra, authentic materials that we got to see in class. But also, be prepared for 10-12 word vocab quizzes every class session. She will give you the words ahead of time so they aren't too difficult.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Super interesting class! We had several discussion posts but none were too hard. 3 group projects that were pretty open to interpretation. My only complaint is she doesn't really give examples of what she wants for the projects. I liked her lectures a lot and she brings in guest speakers. Very sweet and helpful professor!

My Intro to Asian Culture class with Dr. Huang is my favorite class yet. She is from Chengdu and knows everything there is to know about the region, and she knows how to give a really good lecture. My section is a 3 hour class, but I've never had the urge to go to sleep, which is saying a lot. I'm looking forward to having her in the future!
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures
